race.name: Dusty Gravel Series - Andenne
race.tagline: Belgian Ardennes singletrack and Mosane valley terrain near Andenne.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Belgian Ardennes. Moderate elevation with scenic countryside.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional Belgium event. Ardennes terrain with small-medium local field.

biased_opinion.summary: Dusty Gravel Series - Andenne is a regional event in Belgium‚ÄîArdennes terrain with moderate elevation. The Belgian countryside is scenic, but the small-medium local field, regional organization, and limited prestige keep it in Tier 4.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid regional Belgium gravel race. Worth it for Belgium/European riders. Not worth traveling internationally for.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're local to Belgium/Europe‚Äîyes, it's solid. If you're traveling internationally‚Äîskip it.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better Belgium races: Flanders Legacy Gravel, Houffa Gravel.

logistics.lodging_strategy: Andenne has limited lodging. Consider nearby cities.

non_negotiables.why: Belgian weather is variable with rain possible.
Belgian Ardennes require sustained rolling effort.

logistics.explanation: Start was scheduled for 9:00 AM but delayed to 9:30 with no explanation, demonstrating what rider Alex calls "belgische Ruhe" (Belgian calmness). Race packets available one hour before start without the hectic nature of German amateur races, but the unexplained delay killed warm-up time and forced a cold start.

length.explanation: Two distance options available: 75km with 1000m elevation and 100km with 1400m elevation. The race starts with 1km through town then immediately hits an 8km climb that's very steep in the first 2km - what rider Alex describes as "mal so gar nicht meine Welt" (absolutely not my world). More compact than Grinduro.

technicality.explanation: Surfaces that "teilweise nichts mehr mit einem Gravelparcours zu tun hatten" (partially had nothing to do with a gravel course anymore). Includes singletrack sections where riders risked falling 1 meter into ditches if they went off course. Belgian course design is "schmerzfreier" - more extreme than typical gravel. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: The opening 8km climb hits you immediately after 1km through town, with very steep grades in the first 2km. The 75km route packs 1000m of elevation while the 100km option delivers 1400m through the rolling Condroz Namurois terrain - substantial climbing that separates riders early. Less climbing than The Mid South.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 56¬∞F and lows of 40¬∞F, with a 49% chance of rain on any given day, and gusts reaching 32 mph. The very rough course created mechanical carnage - "Das Rennen war von zahlreichen Defekten √ºbers√§t" (the race was riddled with numerous mechanicals). Riders repeatedly struggled with tire punctures due to harsh surface conditions that punished equipment throughout the day. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

altitude.explanation: Racing through the Mosane valley and Condroz Namurois keeps you at typical Belgian elevations - no altitude effects despite the substantial climbing through the wooded Ardennes terrain. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds ‚Äî no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: The route crosses Condroz Namurois and Mosane valley terrain that pushes beyond traditional gravel into MTB-like singletrack. Riders navigate wooded paths requiring technical handling skills to avoid going off course into meter-deep ditches - adventure through consequence.

prestige.explanation: 2025 race won by Lukas Malezsewski, followed by Adne Koster and Michiel van Vliet, but as a new series it lacks established reputation. Only 5 German riders among the 250 participants, suggesting limited international draw for this inaugural edition.

race_quality.explanation: The 30-minute start delay with no explanation undermined organization, though the Belgian calmness meant race packets were available an hour before start. Course challenges riders with varied surfaces from gravel to technical singletrack, but execution shows first-year growing pains.

experience.explanation: Part of Belgium Bike Festival described as "a 100% bike event for lovers of two wheels" with MTB, cyclo, gravel, demonstrations and exhibitions. The relaxed Belgian atmosphere contrasts sharply with German race hecticness, creating a distinctly laid-back cycling weekend vibe.

community.explanation: Belgian event culture with race packets available an hour before start and none of the hectic nature from German amateur races. Part of a 3-race Wallonia series with points rankings, drawing about 250 riders split between distance options for a solid regional field.

field_depth.explanation: 250 participants divided between two distance options, with only 5 German riders making the trip. Winners Lukas Malezsewski, Adne Koster, and Michiel van Vliet suggest regional competitive depth, but limited international participation for a first-year series event. Thinner field than Ouray Gravel Grinder.

value.explanation: Part of Belgium Bike Festival weekend with exhibitions, demonstrations, and multiple cycling disciplines beyond just the gravel race. Series events typically run 120-159‚Ç¨ based on related Dusty Gravel pricing, delivering festival access plus challenging Condroz terrain for reasonable European standards.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs ‚Ç¨60-80. Belgium festival weekend means premium accommodation costs, plus likely Brussels Airport transfer (~100km) for international travel. Series pricing typically 120-159‚Ç¨ for similar distances, with secure bike parking and finisher packages included - standard European gravel race expenses without budget-breaking elements. Higher total cost than Badlands.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

videos.title: Dusty Gravel Andenne 2025
videos.description:
Hi, I am Laurens.

A 23y old student sharing his adventures on the bike trying to balance my studies and offroad racing. 

Share your thoughts in the comments!

videos.curation_reason: First-person race breakdown specifically from Dusty Gravel Andenne 2025 with detailed race insights.

videos.title: Comeback in de Ardennen! 4e (of 5e) in Dusty Gravel Series Andenne  | Gravelrace na blessure [subs]
videos.description:
Na weken van herstel en twijfels was het eindelijk zover: de eerste manche van de Dusty Gravel Series in het prachtige maar verraderlijke Andenne.

üí• Een technisch parcours, veel klimwerk en stevige concurrentie. Ik stond aan de start met nog wat stijfheid in de bil en rug, en een hand die wat gevoelig was maar vastberaden om te knallen.

Het resultaat? Een chocolade medaille, 4e plaats,  en daar ben ik √©cht tevreden mee. Zeker na een periode waarin alles even on hold stond.

üìπ In deze video neem ik je mee in het verloop van de race.

00:00 Intro
02:27 Start wedstrijd
06:00 Michiel Van Vliet zet me op mijn plaats
08:35 Stevige klim die voor afscheiding zorgt
12:05 Ik moet definitief lossen
14:30 Opgeraapt door achtervolgers
17:01 Solo tot de finish
19:00 Outro

videos.title: La Gileppe Gravel Trophy 09/08/2025 POV | Dusty Gravel Series
videos.description:
üìç Location: La Gileppe, Belgium  
üö¥ Event: La Gileppe Gravel Trophy ‚Äì Dusty Gravel Series  
üìè Distance: 117.6 km  
‚õ∞Ô∏è Elevation gain: 1749 m  
‚è±Ô∏è Duration: 4h 02m  
‚ö° Average speed: 29.1 km/h  
üèÅ  Age group M40 [P7/24]
  
Sadly, with the constant starting and stopping of the camera, I lost track and ended up filming too many paved sections, leaving much of the gravel out of the footage.
This was a beautiful gravel race in the stunning Hautes fagnes, and the organization was excellent


00:01 Rolling start from the back of the group, fighting to go gain places on the first climb
06:54 riding a fast decent to catch up with other guys
08:17 last push to a nice group
13:25 keeping the pace high
15:00 long climb
23:00 descent with water crossing
26:20 mud party
28:00 long fast descent
33:00 long climb
41:55 + 1:18:42 feed zone, you can take a bottle and drop the other one. Very well organised! And start of another long climb
45:07 fast fagnes!
56:05 long climb again!
1:00:00 and the descent
1:07:50 gravel climb
1:19:50 rough gravel descent
1:20:52 start second and final lap. Right for short distance, left for long distance. The climb blew the group to pieces, and I rode the second lap entirely on my own. I managed to catch a few riders, but no one came past me anymore.



---


#POV #Cycling #Gravel #GravelPOV #GravelRiding #DustyGravel #LaGileppe #CyclingLife #BikeLife #GravelCycling #CyclingPOV #GravelRace #CyclingEvent #CyclingBelgium #ElevationGain #CyclingStats

quotes.text: The race start is always really really hard, something I really struggle with. It's just so so hard in the beginning and I'm just really trying to hang on, and then after quite some time, the race always slows down a bit.

key_challenges.name: Race start
key_challenges.description: Always really really hard, something riders really struggle with. It's so hard in the beginning and you're just trying to hang on.

key_challenges.name: Small grass pot section
key_challenges.description: Small grass pot caused a crash when front wheel disappeared suddenly, resulting in finding yourself on the ground.

race_day_tips.text: You really need to have a good group around you because the race is long and doing a lot on your own is not ideal.
After the hard race start, the race always slows down a bit, at least the groups you're in, and then the real race can start.

additional_quotes.text: I almost did 20 hours that week, which is something I definitely don't do a lot. At the start line I felt that my legs were a bit tired but I was very much looking forward to racing.
It's almost as if when I'm doing a lot, I'm really pushing my body that in my head I feel way more confident about myself than when I'm having just a regular week.

rider_intel.search_text: The Dusty Gravel Series race in Andenne features an extremely challenging start that riders describe as really hard, where you're just trying to hang on before the pace eventually settles. The course includes technical sections with small grass pots that can catch your front wheel and cause crashes. Mechanical issues are common, with riders experiencing problems like pedals falling out and chains dropping multiple times during the race. The race is long enough that group dynamics become crucial - riders emphasize the importance of finding a good group since doing a lot of the race alone is not ideal. After the intense opening, the race typically slows down and groups form, which is when the real racing begins. The level of competition is described as high even at the amateur level, with riders using this race as qualification attempts for World Championships.
